content.description: Sneakers are optional, falling is not! Climb obvious wide crack up slabby face. Either layback the crack or take it straight on. It will not present any problems.
content.protection: Don't even bother with a pad, you'd probably fly passed it anyway as you helplessly bounce your way down the steep hillside of boulders.
content.location: From Jack in the Box head straight downhill through a narrow passage between two large boulders then cut left and head across the hillside (some easy bush-wacking required) for about thirty feet. Sneaker crack will be on your left and faces downhill.

content.description: Sit start on left edge and right seam edge. High heel and reach up to crimp and mantle to the lip.

This rig looks casual as approaching it due to it diminitive size and straight forwardness but don't be fooled this little line packs a punch! 

  Sit start on the same hold as you would for The Box (v8), put your left foot out on the large foot hold out left and press your way up to the obvious crimp 3 feet above, match the crimp and top out.
content.location: Just right of Help Meat (v3+), starting on the same hold as The Box (v8)

content.description: Several hard moves in a short space with nearly the perfect landing below, a great problem to get on if you are bouldering alone. Stand start on crimps and move up to next set of crimps then to slopers on edge. Bear down, find your feet and slap to the rim above. Top out.
content.protection: Boulder Pad: Just one pad for this sweet guy.
content.location: Just to the left of the Box boulder where the access trail comes into the bottom of the area.

content.description: Sit start with left hand on slim crimp, right hand on sidepull pinch under the crack. High foot, slap out left to a sloper than pull through to jug. top out from there, about 7-8 ft.
Enter a description of this area.
